revised_title: Investigating the Hydration Mechanisms of Acetaldehyde
tldr: The authors studied the hydration of acetaldehyde using a thermal method to investigate the reaction's mechanism. They found that the main catalytic process is unlikely to involve simultaneous attack by an acid and a base, suggesting that a ternary mechanism might not be common in acid-base catalysis. This research helps to understand the reaction kinetics and mechanisms of hydration reactions in organic chemistry.
